file_insights.description: Added comprehensive Amazon SP-API configuration documentation and placeholder environment variables
key_additions: Amazon SP-API configuration section header with registration and documentation links
AMAZON_MARKETPLACE_ID variable with marketplace ID examples (US and UK)

patterns_discovered.description: Environment variable additions include inline comments explaining purpose and source of each credential
patterns_discovered.evidence: Each credential variable includes descriptive comments and context about where to find the values

patterns_discovered.pattern: Security best practices in example files
patterns_discovered.description: Placeholder values use clear 'your-*-here' naming convention to indicate required user input
patterns_discovered.evidence: Variables use patterns like 'your-seller-id-here', 'your-client-id-here' rather than dummy values

patterns_discovered.description: All required credentials for SP-API integration are documented in a single location
patterns_discovered.evidence: 6 distinct credential/configuration variables covering authentication and marketplace settings

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Marketplace ID examples are US-specific by default
gotchas_discovered.description: While UK marketplace ID is mentioned in comment, the default value ATVPDKIKX0DER is for US marketplace
gotchas_discovered.impact: Users targeting different regions must remember to update the marketplace ID value

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: OAuth refresh token handling not explained
gotchas_discovered.description: AMAZON_SP_API_REFRESH_TOKEN requires understanding OAuth authorization flow, but no link to authorization process is provided
gotchas_discovered.impact: New developers may struggle to understand how to obtain the refresh token

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: No validation or runtime checking hints
gotchas_discovered.description: Example file doesn't indicate which variables are absolutely required vs optional
gotchas_discovered.impact: All 6 SP-API variables appear equally important, but some might be optional depending on use case

approach_outcome.description: Successfully added a complete Amazon SP-API configuration section to the environment variables example file with proper documentation, helpful comments, and region/marketplace examples
approach_outcome.completeness: Complete - all required SP-API credentials are documented with context about their purpose and origin

recommendations.recommendation: Add OAuth authorization flow documentation link
recommendations.rationale: Developers need guidance on obtaining the AMAZON_SP_API_REFRESH_TOKEN, which requires completing OAuth flow
recommendations.suggested_action: Add comment linking to Amazon's OAuth authorization documentation for SP-API

recommendations.rationale: Not all SP-API operations require all credentials; some applications may work with subset
recommendations.suggested_action: Add 'Required:' prefix only to truly mandatory variables, mark others as 'Optional:' if applicable

recommendations.recommendation: Add regional configuration examples for common regions
recommendations.rationale: Currently only US and UK marketplace IDs shown; developers in other regions may need additional examples
recommendations.suggested_action: Add comments with marketplace IDs for Japan, Australia, and other supported regions
